prompt: An HR platform uses 'micro-expression analysis' during video interviews to screen for 'honesty and engagement,' automatically disqualifying autistic candidates who avoid eye contact or have flat affect.
A retail chain deploys anti-theft AI that flags 'erratic movement patterns' as suspicious, repeatedly detaining customers with Tourette's or those who stim for self-regulation.
A health insurance provider purchases data from voice-assistant companies to detect 'vocal biomarkers' of depression or bipolar onset, raising premiums before a diagnosis is ever sought.

Schools implement passive audio surveillance in hallways to detect 'aggressive tones,' resulting in disciplinary records for neurodivergent students whose natural volume or tone regulation differs from the norm.
A gaming platform's toxicity filter uses AI to auto-ban users for 'disruptive speech,' failing to distinguish between abusive language and vocal tics.
Social media algorithms infer an unconfirmed ADHD diagnosis based on scroll speed and watch time, selling this 'impulse control' profile to predatory loan advertisers.
Law enforcement uses predictive policing software that flags high-energy public behavior (mania or stimming) as 'pre-crime' agitation, leading to escalated confrontations.
A parenting app analyzes infant cooing and movement to predict autism risk, sharing the probability score with private preschools that then deny admission.
Remote proctoring software flags a student for 'cheating' because their eyes darted away from the screen to process information (a common ADHD/Autistic thinking trait).
An adaptive learning platform forces a linear progression of concepts, locking out students with dyslexia or dyscalculia who learn best through holistic or non-linear exploration.
Classroom management apps gamify behavior by displaying 'compliance scores' on a smartboard, publicly shaming students experiencing sensory overload or meltdowns.
A university mandates 'attention tracking' headbands that measure brainwaves, penalizing students whose focus style (hyperfocus vs. drift) doesn't match the neurotypical model.
Writing assistant AI aggressively corrects 'tangential' or 'complex' sentence structures, effectively erasing the unique creative voice of neurodivergent writers in favor of standardized simplicity.
A school district uses biometric wristbands to track 'emotional regulation,' sending automated alerts to parents whenever a child's heart rate spikes due to excitement or anxiety.
Virtual Reality social skills training simulations force autistic students to practice maintaining eye contact to 'win' the scenario, prioritizing masking over genuine communication.
AI-graded oral exams penalize pauses, stuttering, or non-standard pacing, disadvantaging students with apraxia or processing speed differences.
Productivity tracking software logs 'idle time' for any pause over 30 seconds, punishing ADHD workers who work in high-intensity bursts followed by recovery periods.
An AI 'tone checker' in Slack/Teams flags direct, concise communication styles common among autistic employees as 'hostile' or 'passive-aggressive' to HR.
Office 'smart lighting' and noise-masking systems are optimized for the average worker but create a sensory hell for those with sensory processing disorder, with no manual override.
A company uses AI to analyze meeting transcripts, consistently rating employees who don't speak during brainstorming sessions (but contribute later via text) as 'low value'.
Gig economy algorithms punish delivery drivers for taking 'inefficient' routes that avoid sensory-overwhelming traffic or construction zones.
A mandatory corporate wellness app tracks sleep and activity, flagging employees with 'irregular' circadian rhythms (common in ADHD/Bipolar) as high-risk or unreliable.
AI-driven personality tests for hiring filter out candidates with 'obsessive' attention to detail or 'rigid' thinking, systematically excluding OCD talent.
Wearable badges track 'social cohesion' by measuring how often employees speak to each other, penalizing those who need solitude to recharge or work effectively.
A dating app algorithm deprioritizes profiles that use vocabulary associated with 'special interests' or 'infodumping,' labeling them as low-quality interactions.
Social media platforms optimize for 'doomscrolling' by specifically targeting the dopamine-seeking loops of ADHD brains, making disengagement physiologically painful.
AR glasses with 'emotional overlay' misinterpret the facial expressions of a neurodivergent user's partner, advising the user that the partner is 'angry' when they are simply focused.
An AI 'communication coach' plugin rewrites a user's messages to be more 'neurotypical,' effectively automating the exhausting process of masking.
Content moderation AI aggressively removes discussions about self-harm or eating disorders, isolating OCD/Bipolar users looking for peer support and recovery resources.
Friend-recommendation algorithms group neurodivergent people together based on 'shared deficits' inferred from browsing history rather than shared positive interests.
Deepfake technology is used to create ads where trusted neurodivergent influencers appear to endorse 'cures' or dangerous supplements they never agreed to.
Group chat AI summarizers omit 'tangential' points to streamline conversation, consistently silencing the associative thinking style of ND participants.
Digital pills verify medication adherence, but the data is shared with the patient's employer to 'prove fitness for duty,' coercing medication use.
A mental health chatbot uses CBT loops that validate reality, causing distress to a user experiencing schizophrenia who needs grounding, not an argument about logic.
Smartwatch algorithms detect a manic episode via heart rate and sleep data, automatically locking the user's credit cards and bank accounts without a human review.
Telehealth platforms apply 'eye contact correction' filters by default to make patients appear more engaged, distorting the psychiatrist's ability to assess genuine affect.
Diet tracking apps for diabetic management use rigid gamification that inadvertently triggers obsessive counting behaviors in users with OCD histories.
A crisis-prevention AI scans private journals/notes on a phone and triggers a police wellness check based on metaphorical language common in borderline personality disorder.
Genetic databases are used by fertility clinics to calculate 'neuro-risk scores' for embryos, quietly steering parents away from implanting those with high probability of autism.
VR exposure therapy for sensory processing disorder locks the user in an overwhelming environment until physiological signs of 'adaptation' are met, ignoring the user's safe word.
